result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chase Allen Piper

records.addlTxt: 1:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chase Allen Piper in court.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Chase Allen Piper. Court orders case dismissed and read in.
Plea hearing on August 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

10:50 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chase Allen Piper in court.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Chase Allen Piper. Right to jury trial waived by defendant freely and voluntarily; State consent.
Plea hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Calendar call on July 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Activity: Preliminary Hearing  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:22 AM Defendant Chase Allen Piper in court by video with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy by video.  Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on March 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Activity: initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:13 PM Defendant Chase Allen Piper in court with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy.  Noah M Tylenda   and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.   Cash bond set of $2000.00   with conditions. Must post at Rock County Jail by 5 pm today or turn himself in. Preliminary hearing requested and set for March 14, 2022 at 10:15 AM.
Initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
